intro: Phoebe sheareri var. sheareri, commonly known as the Shearer's phoebe, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in coastal or mountainous areas where it thrives in well-drained conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
